Gunner’s Mate Wahl Also Wins Honor |
by Saving Flag

ClLief Gunner's Mate Jacob Wahl, 609
North Third street, Camden, who has
seen fifteen months’ active service in
foreign waters, has married an English |
girl. She was Miss Beatrice Swann, |
and the couple were married in Holy |
Trinity Church, Liverpool, October 14.

The bride's father is a veteran'of the
Boer war. She Las three brothers in
the British army. Wahl has become a,
hero. When he was on the destroyer |
Amenic the flag was lost in a gale and
Wahl recovered it. He was allowed to
keep the flag as a reward. |

to training camps—this is the proud dis- |
tinction of Mr. and Mrs. W. J. Fairman |

The boys are known as the “Fighting
Fairmans.” They are Sergeant William
De, Fairman, now in France, attached
to Company M, 110th Infantry; Jesse S
Fairman, who is chasing German sub-
marines, and Frank and David Fairman
who expect any day to go to training
camps Sergeant Fairnman, recently |
wounded, is now a convalescent in a base
hospital. {

The Fairmans come of old fighting |
stock. Their grandfather shouldered a
musket in the Civil War. Only his age
deterred the father of the boys fromm
being beside his son, William, Shortly
after the outbreak of war with Germany
the father tried to enlist.
